Package com.intellij.execution

Interface RunnerAndConfigurationSettings


  • public interface RunnerAndConfigurationSettings
    Describes a complete persisted run configuration (as displayed in the Run/Debug Configurations dialog), together with runner-specific settings.
    See Also:
    RunManager#createConfiguration(String, ConfigurationFactory)

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getType

        ConfigurationType getType()
        Returns the type of the run configuration.

      • getFactory

        ConfigurationFactory getFactory()
        Returns the factory used to create the run configuration.
        Returns:
        the factory

      • isTemplate

        boolean isTemplate()
        Returns true if this configuration settings object represents a template used to create other configurations of the same type (in other words, an item under the "Defaults" node of the Run/Debug Configurations dialog).
        Returns:
        true if the configuration is a template, false otherwise.

      • isTemporary

        boolean isTemporary()
        Returns true if this configuration is temporary and will be deleted when the temporary configurations limit is exceeded.
        Returns:
        true if the configuration is temporary, false otherwise.

      • isShared

        default boolean isShared()
        Checks whether this run configuration is stored in a file (therefore, could be shared through VCS). Note that there are 2 different ways of storing run configuration in a file: .xml file in .idea/runConfigurations folder (or project.ipr file) and arbitrary .run.xml file anywhere within the project content. Effectively, this method is equivalent to isStoredInDotIdeaFolder() || isStoredInArbitraryFileInProject()
        See Also:
        isStoredInLocalWorkspace(), isStoredInDotIdeaFolder(), isStoredInArbitraryFileInProject()

      • setShared

        @Deprecated
default void setShared(boolean value)
        Deprecated. There are different ways of storing run configuration in a file, use storeInLocalWorkspace(), storeInDotIdeaFolder() or storeInArbitraryFileInProject(String)

      • storeInLocalWorkspace

        void storeInLocalWorkspace()
        Make this run configuration impossible to share through VCS, store it in .idea/workspace.xml file.
        See Also:
        storeInDotIdeaFolder(), storeInArbitraryFileInProject(String)

      • isStoredInLocalWorkspace

        boolean isStoredInLocalWorkspace()
        Checks if this run configuration is not shared through VCS, i.e. stored it in .idea/workspace.xml file.
        See Also:
        isStoredInDotIdeaFolder(), isStoredInArbitraryFileInProject()

      • storeInDotIdeaFolder

        void storeInDotIdeaFolder()
        Make this run configuration possible to share through VCS: store it as an .xml file in .idea/runConfigurations folder (or project.ipr file). Note that there are 2 different ways of storing run configuration in a file: .xml file in .idea/runConfigurations folder (or project.ipr file) and arbitrary .run.xml file anywhere within the project content.
        See Also:
        storeInArbitraryFileInProject(String), storeInLocalWorkspace()

      • isStoredInDotIdeaFolder

        boolean isStoredInDotIdeaFolder()
        Checks if this run configuration is stored as an .xml file in .idea/runConfigurations folder (or project.ipr file). Note that there are 2 different ways of storing run configuration in a file: .xml file in .idea/runConfigurations folder (or project.ipr file) and arbitrary .run.xml file anywhere within the project content.
        See Also:
        isStoredInArbitraryFileInProject(), isStoredInLocalWorkspace()

      • storeInArbitraryFileInProject

        void storeInArbitraryFileInProject(java.lang.String filePath)
        Make this run configuration possible to share through VCS: store it in a .run.xml file anywhere within the project content. It's possible to store more than one run configuration in one .run.xml file. Note that there are 2 different ways of storing run configuration in a file: .xml file in .idea/runConfigurations folder (or project.ipr file) and arbitrary .run.xml file anywhere within the project content.
        Parameters:
        filePath - needs to be within the project content, otherwise the run configuration will be removed from the model.
        See Also:
        storeInDotIdeaFolder(), storeInLocalWorkspace()

      • isStoredInArbitraryFileInProject

        boolean isStoredInArbitraryFileInProject()
        Checks if this run configuration is stored in a .run.xml file within the project content. Note that there are 2 different ways of storing run configuration in a file: .xml file in .idea/runConfigurations folder (or project.ipr file) and arbitrary .run.xml file anywhere within the project content.
        See Also:
        isStoredInDotIdeaFolder(), isStoredInLocalWorkspace()

      • getPathIfStoredInArbitraryFileInProject

        java.lang.String getPathIfStoredInArbitraryFileInProject()
        Returns:
        full path of the .run.xml file if isStoredInArbitraryFileInProject() is true, null otherwise.

      • setTemporary

        void setTemporary(boolean temporary)
        Marks the configuration as temporary or permanent.
        Parameters:
        temporary - true if the configuration is temporary, false if it's permanent.

      • getConfiguration

        RunConfiguration getConfiguration()
        Returns the RunConfiguration instance that will be used to execute this run configuration.

      • setName

        void setName(java.lang.String name)
        Sets the name of the configuration.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the configuration

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name of the configuration.
        Returns:
        the name of the configuration.

      • getUniqueID

        java.lang.String getUniqueID()

      • getRunnerSettings

        <Settings extends RunnerSettings> Settings getRunnerSettings(ProgramRunner<Settings> runner)
        Returns the runner-managed settings for the specified runner.
        Parameters:
        runner - the runner for which the settings are requested.
        Returns:
        the settings, or null if the runner doesn't provide any settings or the settings aren't configured for this configuration.

      • getConfigurationSettings

        ConfigurationPerRunnerSettings getConfigurationSettings(ProgramRunner runner)
        Returns the configuration-managed settings for the specified runner.
        Parameters:
        runner - the runner for which the settings are requested.
        Returns:
        the settings, or null if the configuration doesn't provide any settings specific to this runner or the settings aren't configured for this configuration.

      • checkSettings

        default void checkSettings()
                    throws RuntimeConfigurationException
        Checks whether the run configuration settings are valid.
        Throws:
        RuntimeConfigurationException - if the configuration settings contain a non-fatal problem which the user should be warned about but the execution should still be allowed
        RuntimeConfigurationError - if the configuration settings contain a fatal problem which makes it impossible to execute the run configuration.

      • checkSettings

        void checkSettings(Executor executor)
            throws RuntimeConfigurationException
        Checks whether the run configuration settings are valid for execution with the specified executor.
        Parameters:
        executor - the executor which will be used to run the configuration, or null if the check is not specific to an executor.
        Throws:
        RuntimeConfigurationException - if the configuration settings contain a non-fatal problem which the user should be warned about but the execution should still be allowed
        RuntimeConfigurationError - if the configuration settings contain a fatal problem which makes it impossible to execute the run configuration.

      • canRunOn

        @Deprecated
default boolean canRunOn(ExecutionTarget target)
        Deprecated. use ExecutionTargetManager.canRun(RunnerAndConfigurationSettings, ExecutionTarget) instead

      • createFactory

        Factory<RunnerAndConfigurationSettings> createFactory()
        Returns a factory object which can be used to create a copy of this configuration.
        Returns:
        copying factory instance

      • setEditBeforeRun

        void setEditBeforeRun(boolean b)
        Sets the "Before launch: Show this page" flag (for showing the run configuration settings before execution).
        Parameters:
        b - if true, the settings dialog will be displayed before launching this configuration.

      • isEditBeforeRun

        boolean isEditBeforeRun()
        Returns the "Before launch: Show this page" flag (for showing the run configuration settings before execution).
        Returns:
        if true, the settings dialog will be displayed before launching this configuration.

      • setActivateToolWindowBeforeRun

        void setActivateToolWindowBeforeRun(boolean value)
        Sets the "Before launch: Activate tool window" flag (for activation tool window Run/Debug etc.)
        Parameters:
        value - if true, the tool window will be activated before launching this configuration.

      • isActivateToolWindowBeforeRun

        boolean isActivateToolWindowBeforeRun()
        Returns the "Before launch: Activate tool window" flag (for activation tool window Run/Debug etc.)
        Returns:
        if true (it's default value), the tool window will be activated before launching this configuration.

      • isSingleton

        @Deprecated
default boolean isSingleton()
        Deprecated. Use RunConfiguration.isAllowRunningInParallel()

      • setSingleton

        @Deprecated
default void setSingleton(boolean value)
        Deprecated. Use RunConfiguration.setAllowRunningInParallel(boolean)}

      • setFolderName

        void setFolderName(java.lang.String folderName)
        Sets the name of the folder under which the configuration is displayed in the "Run/Debug Configurations" dialog.
        Parameters:
        folderName - the folder name, or null if the configuration is displayed on the top level.

      • getFolderName

        java.lang.String getFolderName()
        Returns the name of the folder under which the configuration is displayed in the "Run/Debug Configurations" dialog.
        Returns:
        the folder name, or null if the configuration is displayed on the top level.
